result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance D Martin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lance D Martin in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Lance D Martin.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting a soft plea hearing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Lance D Martin in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Lance D Martin.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. For reason stated on the record, defense requested an additional scheduling date. State does not object. Court order the defendant to contact JusticePoint and to remain in compliance. Court reminds defendant that all bail conditions remain in full force and effect. Court adjourns matter for a scheduling conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Lance D Martin in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting an additional status conference. Case is adjourned.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Lance D Martin in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defendant is reminded by the Court to continue working with Justice Point. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 057506,
Payable Number: 1014855,
Receipt Number: 22RP025148,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered an oral no contact order with G.H., G.E.L, L.M.J

Defendant Lance D Martin in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
